en.reason: Following a recent House of Representatives election, Japan is grappling with the immediate political aftermath, including parliamentary debates on critical policy issues like fiscal stimulus and consumption tax. A central theme emerging is the profound impact of social media and misinformation on election integrity and public discourse, prompting calls for regulation to safeguard democratic processes. This period of intense self-reflection among political parties, coupled with the struggles of the opposition, highlights Japan's unique challenge in adapting its traditionally structured political landscape to the rapid evolution of digital communication and its influence on voter behavior.
